title: Goodyear affair: Judicial authorities conduct raids in France, Belgium and Luxembourg
summary: The offensive by judicial authorities is part of an investigation into how the American manufacturer opaquely managed, for years, a crisis concerning some of its truck tires suspected of having caused accidents.

title: Two French prison officers killed in van attack, prisoner escapes
summary: The prison convoy was attacked in Normandy, and the prisoner it was carrying escaped. The justice minister said the perpetrators 'will be arrested, they will be judged and they will be punished.'

title: Cannes 2024 opens with Meryl Streep receiving an honorary Palme D'Or
summary: The 77th edition of the Cannes Film Festival opened on Tuesday with a focus on the fight against sexual violence in French cinema, a star-studded parade featuring Meryl Streep and a plea for help from an Iranian filmmaker forced into exile.

title: Soldiers in the Donbas resist despite relentless Russian drone attacks
summary: Ukrainian fighters are adapting to survive the chaos of the attacks in a conflict in which the emergence of unmanned aerial vehicles has changed the rules of the game.

title: Summer 2023 was the hottest in the northern hemisphere in 2000 years
summary: The months of June, July and August exceeded the average summer temperature for that period by more than 2°C, according to a study published Tuesday in 'Nature.'

title: Louis Garrel at Cannes: 'I doubt everything, including myself'
summary: The French actor and director, who showcases his comedic talent in Quentin Dupieux's 'The Second Act,' which opened the Festival on Tuesday, May 14, spoke with Le Monde.

title: The Italian military has been called in to help hunt wild boar
summary: Nearly 180 soldiers have been deployed to hunt down the feral pigs proliferating across the country. The government aims to address public concern and protect agri-food exports amid an African swine fever epidemic.

title: Blinken delivers message of support to Ukrainians while in Kyiv
summary: The US secretary of state, on his fourth visit to Kyiv since the beginning of the Russian invasion, said the US will back Ukraine until its security is 'guaranteed.'

title: Exhausted Gaza inhabitants flee Israel's invasion of Rafah, but 'to go where?'
summary: More than 360,000 people have left Rafah, fleeing toward the center of the Gaza Strip in yet another forced displacement. Southern Gaza has been deprived of humanitarian aid since May 7.

title: Georgian parliament adopts 'foreign influence' bill amid protests
summary: After protests in Tbilisi against a Russian-style bill to label some NGOs and media outlets as serving a 'foreign power,' Georgian lawmakers voted 84 to 30 to pass it, despite EU warnings that this would be 'a serious obstacle for Georgia in its European perspective.'

title: War in Ukraine: US aid will not be enough to level the playing field in 2024
summary: The US Congress finally approved a new $60.8 billion aid package at the end of April. But it will be some time before its effects are felt.

title: Court convicts German far-right politician of using Nazi slogan
summary: The leader of the AfD in Thuringia, Bjoern Hoecke, has been convicted of using a banned Nazi slogan at a political rally.

title: Speaker Mike Johnson's appearance at Trump's felony trial marks a remarkable moment in US politics
summary: The speaker is leading a growing list of Republican lawmakers who are criticizing the US judicial system as they rally to Trump's side.

title: French senators warn that France is 'submerged by drug trafficking'
summary: After six months of investigation, a report by a Sénat committee on drug trafficking published its conclusions on Tuesday, May 14. It presents a worrying assessment of the situation, along with proposals for reform.

title: New Caledonia: Night of violent rioting revives grim memories of 1984
summary: Roads blocked, businesses torched: On Monday, a wave of unrest spread across the French territory in the Pacific, as lawmakers in Paris were set to debate a constitutional revision on its status. In the capital Nouméa, violent clashes broke out with the police.

title: Shoah Memorial in Paris tagged with red hands
summary: The hands were painted on the Wall of the Righteous, which honors the people who helped rescue Jews in France during the Second World War.

title: #MeToo: The making of a historic photo on Le Monde's front page
summary: One hundred French celebrities agreed to be photographed together to denounce sexual and gender-based violence.

title: US announces tariffs on $18 billion of China imports, including 100% on electric vehicles
summary: This was part of a series of tariff rises on $18 billion worth of Chinese imports that the White House announced on Tuesday.

title: How Le Monde has covered the Israeli-Palestinian conflict since 1945
summary: Since the founding of Le Monde in late 1944, the newspaper's coverage and editorial position have continuously fueled suspicions among readers: Pro-Israeli? Pro-Palestinian? Every article is dissected and discussed with a zeal not seen with any other international issue.

title: Fatal attack on a prison van: The story of Mohamed Amra, a dangerous prisoner who flew under the radar
summary: The escape of a drug trafficker from the Incarville tollbooth in the Eure region on Tuesday left two people dead and three seriously injured. In a sign of the seriousness of the incident, the case has been referred to the National Jurisdiction for Combating Organized Crime. The trade unions are calling for a 'blockade' of prisons on Wednesday.

title: Trump's lawyers seek to undermine Michael Cohen's credibility at trial
summary: Defense attorneys tried to depict Trump's ex-lawyer as seeking revenge on his former boss, confronting him on the witness stand with his own profane social media posts about Trump and his desire to see the former president in handcuffs.

title: New Caledonia: The Assemblée Nationale approves constitutional reform after tense night on archipelago
summary: After the Sénat, the MPs adopted the text, which expanded the electoral body for New Caledonia's provincial elections. The measure is contested by the pro-independence movement which fears a loss of electoral influence for the Kanak people.

title: Brazil: CEO of state oil company Petrobras dismissed
summary: Jean Paul Prates was fired on Tuesday following a recent spat between Petrobras and shareholders over dividend payments. Former top regulator Magda Chambriard is reported to take over as CEO, according to AFP.

title: Second night of New Caledonian unrest leads to hundreds of injuries
summary: In another night of unrest in the French overseas territory, in protest against a constitutional revision, many were wounded, including 'around 100' law enforcement officers, and one person has been confirmed dead.

title: #MeToo: 100 faces from the movement in France pose in historic photo
summary: One hundred public figures who have spoken out about sexual and gender-based violence have come together to pose for a historic photograph in Le Monde and co-sign an open letter calling for 'an all-encompassing law' on sexual violence.

title: Cannes 2024 opens in a year marked by #MeToo in French cinema
summary: The film festival kicks off on Tuesday, as more French actresses speak out about sexual assault and harassment in the industry.

title: At the Cannes 2024 Festival, an opening ceremony carried by powerful women
summary: Mistress of ceremony Camille Cottin paid tribute to the #MeToo movement, while Juliette Binoche presented Meryl Streep with an honorary Palme d'Or.

title: Second night of riots shakes New Caledonia: 'I didn't think it could come to this'
summary: Two people died in the French overseas territory on Wednesday. The outburst of anger was sparked by a government reform to the territory's electorate.

title: Michael Cohen's 'moral compass' called into question at Trump's trial
summary: Trump's former personal lawyer, a key witness for the prosecution, was rarely thrown off balance during the defense's cross-examination.

title: Interpol issues red notice for escaped French convict Mohamed Amra
summary: Interior Minister Gérald Darmanin said that 'considerable' resources were being mobilized to find the escaped prisoner and the perpetrators of the attack.

title: Zelensky postpones all upcoming foreign visits as Russia's Kharkiv offensive makes progress
summary: The Ukrainian president was expected to visit Spain, and perhaps Portugal, later this week. No reason was given for this decision, but Ukraine is having a hard time fending off the latest Russian assault.

title: Macron declares state of emergency in New Caledonia
summary: The French president has requested that the decree aimed at declaring a state of emergency in the French overseas territory be included to the agenda of a cabinet meeting on Wednesday.

title: Movie theaters have won the platform war
summary: Cinemas are gradually returning to their pre-pandemic audience levels, and streaming platforms seem to be putting aside their strategy of snubbing theatrical releases.

title: 'Megalopolis,' Francis Ford Coppola's latest gamble
summary: Forty-five years after his last Palme d'Or for 'Apocalypse Now,' the American director is back at the Cannes Film Festival with his new film in the official selection. The 85-year-old funded the movie himself, including with mortgages on his vineyards.

title: Slovakia's Prime Minister Fico wounded in shooting
summary: According to local media reports, Robert Fico was shot after a government meeting on Wednesday. He has been taken to hospital.

title: Paris 2024: The Olympic torch relay in maps
summary: The relay began on May 9 in Marseille, a day after the torch arrived from Greece on a 19th century ship. It will reach Paris on July 26 for the opening ceremony after 68 stages, including six overseas territories.

title: War in Sudan: In Darfur, city of El-Fasher under siege by Hemedti's paramilitaries
summary: A dreaded assault by Hemedti's Rapid Support Forces could lead to ethnic clashes in the region where the scars of the 2003 war never healed. More than a million civilians are trapped in Darfur's historic capital.

title: Man charged after dismembered body found under Paris bridge
summary: The suspect said the victim was a disabled man he was caring for. After a dispute turned tragic, the man kept the body under his bed for two months until the smell got too bad.

title: Roman Polanski's 'The Palace,' a disappointing high-society satire
summary: The director's latest film, co-written with his friend, filmmaker Jerzy Skolimowski, brings together a few billionaires and degenerate eccentrics in a Gstaad hotel.

title: Georgia's parliament adopts Russia-style 'foreign influence' law despite protests
summary: Modeled on a piece of Russian legislation designed to silence Vladimir Putin's critics, the text stigmatizes NGOs and media outlets that receive more than 20% of their funding from non-Georgian sources.

title: Under pressure from Trump, Biden hits Chinese electric cars with higher tariffs
summary: US President Joe Biden announced a quadrupling of tariffs on electric vehicles manufactured in China. Trump has been saying for months that China will kill the US car industry.

title: Biden and Trump agree to presidential debate in June
summary: The debate will be hosted by CNN on June 27, with another faceoff set for later in the year in September.
